posts.content:
One of the IP addresses in the IOC provided by Check Point (see parent toot above) 156.146.56.136 was previously reported by Volexity in Zero-Day Exploitation of Atlassian Confluence (02 June 2022). CVE-2022-26134 (9.8 critical, disclosed 02 June 2022 by Atlassian as an exploited zero-day) Confluence Data Center and Server RCE was exploited by likely Chinese actors:

Volexity has reason to believe this exploit is currently in use by multiple threat actors and that the likely country of origin of these attackers is China.

There is a very likely link to Chinese threat actors based on the zero-day exploitation of a VPN. Following Cisco's reporting of ArcaneDoor campaign by state-sponsored actors (likely China) on 24 April 2024. cc: @campuscodi @hrbrmstr @zeljkazorz

#CVE_2024_24919 #activeexploitation #eitw #CheckPoint #VPN #IOC #threatintel #China #cyberespionage

posts.content:
If you have a #CheckPoint firewall with Remote Access VPN etc, you may already be exploited. #CVE_2024_24919 #CVE-2024-24919

With the public availability of #exploit code, exploitation and scanning began overnight. Given how trivial exploitation is, your /etc/shadow is likely stolen and perhaps other files (LDAP secrets).

I would also note that I found the Check Point's IPS rule for this is not reliable. My own exploitation tests were not detected by IPS, but others were. You cannot rely on these logs to conclude you were NOT exploited.

posts.content:
Check Point 31 May 2024 update: Preventative Hotfix for CVE-2024-24919 - Quantum Gateway Information Disclosure

When were exploitation attempts for this vulnerability first seen?
Our retrospective telemetry analysis shows exploitation attempts starting on April 30, 2024. Further investigation (as of May 31st) revealed that the first exploitation attempts started on April 7, 2024. We are actively investigating further.

Check Point also provided 51 IP address/ranges that are indicators of compromise (suspect IP addresses used by threat actors to exploit the vulnerability) h/t @zeljkazorz

#CVE_2024_24919 #CVE #kev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #activeexploitation #eitw #CheckPoint #VPN #IOC #threatintel

posts.content:
Rapid: CVE-2024-24919: Check Point Security Gateway Information Disclosure
Rapid7 warns of CVE-2024-24919 information disclosure vulnerability affecting Check Point Security Gateway. They describe the Check Point security advisory, Mnemonic threat advisory (contains IOC), watchTowr's vulnerability analysis, and that CVE-2024-24919 was added to CISA's KEV Catalog. All of these are linked in the parent toots above. Rapid7 points out what successful web administration panel and SSH logins would appear as in log events. Curiously, they forgot to mention the identified IPs from mnemonic's blog.

#CVE_2024_24919 #CVE #kev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #activeexploitation #eitw #CheckPoint #VPN #IOC

posts.content:
watchTowr: Check Point - Wrong Check Point (CVE-2024-24919)
This is beyond words. watchTowr patch diffed CVE-2024-24919 and confirmed that this is a path traversal (cc: @reverseics) leading to arbitrary file read. This is much more severe and deserves a critical CVSSv3 score. cc: @wdormann

posts.content:
Mnemonic has observed attacker exploitation of CVE-2024-294919 as a zero-day (see above parent toot) since at least 30 April 2024:

mnemonic has observed attempts of exploitation in customer environments since April 30, 2024.

The following IOCs have been observed in customer environments between April 30, 2024, and today (May 29, 2024):

  • Reconnaissance IP: 82.180.133[.]120
  • Exploitation IP: 87.120.8[.]173
  • Exploitation IP: 23.227.203[.]36
  • Exploitation IP: 203.160.68[.]12

#zeroday #CVE_2024_24919 #eitw #activeexploitation #VPN #CheckPoint #vulnerability #cve #threatintel #IOC

fields.name: Blog
fields.value: https://infosec.press/screaminggoat/

posts.content:
mnemonic: Advisory: Active exploitation of Check Point Remote Access VPN vulnerability (CVE-2024-24919)
mnemonic has several observations of the exploit being used in the wild. The vulnerability is particularly critical because it does not require any user interaction or privileges, making it easy to exploit remotely.

The vulnerability allows a threat actor to enumerate and extract password hashes for all local accounts, including the account used to connect to Active Directory. The full extent of the consequences is still unknown. However, it is known that password hashes of legacy local users with password-only authentication can be extracted, including service accounts used to connect to Active Directory. Weak passwords can be compromised, leading to further misuse and potential lateral movement within the network.

h/t: @Chocobo

#zeroday #CVE_2024_24919 #eitw #activeexploitation #VPN #CheckPoint #vulnerability #cve

posts.content:
Check Point: Attempted Zero-Day Exploitation: Important Security Update – Stay Protected Against VPN Information Disclosure (CVE-2024-24919)
Check Point warned on Monday 27 May 2024 of attacker attempts to gain unauthorized access to VPN products. They identified login attempts using old VPN local-accounts relying on unrecommended password-only authentication method. Check Point officially disclosed a sensitive information disclosure vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-24919 (7.5 high):

Potentially allowing an attacker to read certain information on Check Point Security Gateways once connected to the internet and enabled with remote Access VPN or Mobile Access Software Blades. A Security fix that mitigates this vulnerability is available.

This affects CloudGuard Network, Quantum Maestro, Quantum Scalable Chassis, Quantum Security Gateways, Quantum Spark Appliances versions: R80.20.x, R80.20SP (EOL), R80.40 (EOL), R81, R81.10, R81.10.x, R81.20

View the following fix: Preventative Hotfix for CVE-2024-24919 - Quantum Gateway Information Disclosure

h/t to @serghei and @BleepingComputer for their initial news article. cc: @briankrebs @campuscodi @mttaggart @deepthoughts10 @dangoodin

#zeroday #CVE_2024_24919 #eitw #activeexploitation #VPN #CheckPoint #vulnerability #cve

One of the IP addresses in the IOC provided by Check Point (see parent toot above) 156.146.56.136 was previously reported by Volexity in Zero-Day Exploitation of Atlassian Confluence (02 June 2022). CVE-2022-26134 (9.8 critical, disclosed 02 June 2022 by Atlassian as an exploited zero-day) Confluence Data Center and Server RCE was exploited by likely Chinese actors:

Volexity has reason to believe this exploit is currently in use by multiple threat actors and that the likely country of origin of these attackers is China.

There is a very likely link to Chinese threat actors based on the zero-day exploitation of a VPN. Following Cisco's reporting of ArcaneDoor campaign by state-sponsored actors (likely China) on 24 April 2024. cc: @campuscodi @hrbrmstr @zeljkazorz

#CVE_2024_24919 #activeexploitation #eitw #CheckPoint #VPN #IOC #threatintel #China #cyberespionage

posts.content:
If you have a #CheckPoint firewall with Remote Access VPN etc, you may already be exploited. #CVE_2024_24919 #CVE-2024-24919

With the public availability of #exploit code, exploitation and scanning began overnight. Given how trivial exploitation is, your /etc/shadow is likely stolen and perhaps other files (LDAP secrets).

I would also note that I found the Check Point's IPS rule for this is not reliable. My own exploitation tests were not detected by IPS, but others were. You cannot rely on these logs to conclude you were NOT exploited.

posts.content:
Check Point 31 May 2024 update: Preventative Hotfix for CVE-2024-24919 - Quantum Gateway Information Disclosure

When were exploitation attempts for this vulnerability first seen?
Our retrospective telemetry analysis shows exploitation attempts starting on April 30, 2024. Further investigation (as of May 31st) revealed that the first exploitation attempts started on April 7, 2024. We are actively investigating further.

Check Point also provided 51 IP address/ranges that are indicators of compromise (suspect IP addresses used by threat actors to exploit the vulnerability) h/t @zeljkazorz

posts.content:
mnemonic: Advisory: Active exploitation of Check Point Remote Access VPN vulnerability (CVE-2024-24919)
mnemonic has several observations of the exploit being used in the wild. The vulnerability is particularly critical because it does not require any user interaction or privileges, making it easy to exploit remotely.

The vulnerability allows a threat actor to enumerate and extract password hashes for all local accounts, including the account used to connect to Active Directory. The full extent of the consequences is still unknown. However, it is known that password hashes of legacy local users with password-only authentication can be extracted, including service accounts used to connect to Active Directory. Weak passwords can be compromised, leading to further misuse and potential lateral movement within the network.

h/t: @Chocobo

#zeroday #CVE_2024_24919 #eitw #activeexploitation #VPN #CheckPoint #vulnerability #cve

posts.content:
Check Point: Attempted Zero-Day Exploitation: Important Security Update – Stay Protected Against VPN Information Disclosure (CVE-2024-24919)
Check Point warned on Monday 27 May 2024 of attacker attempts to gain unauthorized access to VPN products. They identified login attempts using old VPN local-accounts relying on unrecommended password-only authentication method. Check Point officially disclosed a sensitive information disclosure vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-24919 (7.5 high):

Potentially allowing an attacker to read certain information on Check Point Security Gateways once connected to the internet and enabled with remote Access VPN or Mobile Access Software Blades. A Security fix that mitigates this vulnerability is available.

This affects CloudGuard Network, Quantum Maestro, Quantum Scalable Chassis, Quantum Security Gateways, Quantum Spark Appliances versions: R80.20.x, R80.20SP (EOL), R80.40 (EOL), R81, R81.10, R81.10.x, R81.20

View the following fix: Preventative Hotfix for CVE-2024-24919 - Quantum Gateway Information Disclosure

h/t to @serghei and @BleepingComputer for their initial news article. cc: @briankrebs @campuscodi @mttaggart @deepthoughts10 @dangoodin

#zeroday #CVE_2024_24919 #eitw #activeexploitation #VPN #CheckPoint #vulnerability #cve

🚨 Got an important heads-up for you: CVE-2024-24919 - the Check Point VPN path-traversal vulnerability - is a zero-day you need to be on top of. 👉 Here are 3 reasons why:

⚠️ It’s ridiculously easy to exploit because it's remote, unauthenticated, and many VPN servers are exposed on the Internet.
⚠️ The proof of concept (PoC) is already out there and it's already spread like wildfire.
⚠️ This vulnerability lets attackers read *any file* on the compromised server.

posts.content:
Check Point has released a security update to patch a zero-day exploited in its VPN and security appliances.

Tracked as CVE-2024-24919, the zero-day is an information disclosure that allows threat actor to retrieve data from appliances.

https://support.checkpoint.com/results/sk/sk182336

Security firm Mnemonic says it observed threat actors use the vulnerability to enumerate and extract password hashes, including the accounts used to connect to Active Directory.

https://www.mnemonic.io/resources/blog/advisory-check-point-remote-access-vpn-vulnerability-cve-2024-24919/

EDIT: 30 May 2024: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog

  • CVE-2024-24919 (8.6 high) Check Point Quantum Security Gateways Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-1086 (7.8 high) Linux Kernel Use-After-Free Vulnerability

CVE-2024-24919.description: Potentially allowing an attacker to read certain information on Check Point Security Gateways once connected to the internet and enabled with remote Access VPN or Mobile Access Software Blades. A Security fix that mitigates this vulnerability is available.

posts.content:
Horizon3: CVE-2024-23108: Fortinet FortiSIEM 2nd Order Command Injection Deep-Dive
Fortinet back at it again with another deep dive of Fortinet FortiSIEM. After providing the vulnerability analysis for CVE-2023-34992 (see parent toot above), he briefly explains how CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 are patch bypasses. As @wdormann points out, "The injection-causing semicolon is moved from one argument to another. 🤦‍♂️" Proof of concept is provided.

You've read about it in Bleeping Computer's news article. Check out the vulnerability disclosure timeline here to see Zach Hanley's side of the story about Fortinet's botched disclosure.

#CVE_2024_23108 #proofofconcept #vulnerability #Horizon3 #Fortinet

posts.content:
@wdormann I was there for this! someone noticed some perfect 10.0 CVSSv3 scoring vulnerabilities buried in a 4 month old security advisory without any changelog.

@serghei asked Fortinet PSIRT about them and they straight up lied about it: https://mastodon.social/@serghei/111889892600716875

Zach Hanley's response: https://twitter.com/hacks_zach/status/1755309941982646695

Lol not sure whats going on over there, but they're real were a bypass of the 2023 CVE it got added to

@BleepingComputer posted a subsequent update with the following statement: "After contacting Fortinet once again, we were told their previous statement was “misstated” and that the two new CVEs are variants of the original flaw."

"The PSIRT team followed its process to add two similar variants of the previous CVE (CVE-2023-34992), tracked as CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 to our public advisory FG-IR-23-130, which was published in October 2023. The two new CVEs share the exact same description and score as the initial one; in parallel we updated MITRE. A reminder pointing to the updated Advisory will be included for our customers on Tuesday when Fortinet publishes its monthly advisory." – Fortinet.”

CVE-2024-23108.description: An improper neutralization of special elements used in an os command ('os command injection') in Fortinet FortiSIEM version 7.1.0 through 7.1.1 and 7.0.0 through 7.0.2 and 6.7.0 through 6.7.8 and 6.6.0 through 6.6.3 and 6.5.0 through 6.5.2 and 6.4.0 through 6.4.2 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via via crafted API requests.

posts.content:
#XZ 5.6.2 Released With The Frightening #Backdoor Removed
Lasse Collin released XZ 5.6.2 today with the CVE-2024-3094 backdoor cleared out that was present in the former v5.6 and v5.6.1 releases.
Lasse Collin also announced that Sam James has stepped up as a supporting maintainer moving forward for the XZ project.
The XZ 5.6.2 release also has a few bug fixes.
https://www.phoronix.com/news/XZ-5.6.2-Released

posts.content:
#XZ 5.6.2 Released With The Frightening #Backdoor Removed
Lasse Collin released XZ 5.6.2 today with the CVE-2024-3094 backdoor cleared out that was present in the former v5.6 and v5.6.1 releases.
Lasse Collin also announced that Sam James has stepped up as a supporting maintainer moving forward for the XZ project.
The XZ 5.6.2 release also has a few bug fixes.
https://www.phoronix.com/news/XZ-5.6.2-Released

CVE-2024-3094.description:
Malicious code was discovered in the upstream tarballs of xz, starting with version 5.6.0. 
Through a series of complex obfuscations, the liblzma build process extracts a prebuilt object file from a disguised test file existing in the source code, which is then used to modify specific functions in the liblzma code. This results in a modified liblzma library that can be used by any software linked against this library, intercepting and modifying the data interaction with this library.

CVE-2023-6961.description: The WP Meta SEO plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘Referer’ header in all versions up to, and including, 4.5.12 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

posts.content:
Trend Micro: Decoding Water Sigbin's Latest Obfuscation Tricks
Trend Micro writes about the 8220 gang, a Chinese financially motivated threat actor group known for deploying cryptominers in cloud-based environments and Linux servers. They write about the exploitation of Oracle WebLogic vulnerabilities CVE-2017-3506 (7.4 high) and CVE-2023-21839 (7.5 high) to deploy a cryptocurrency miner via a PowerShell script. They provide an analysis of the bat file. IOC and MITRE ATT&CK TTPs provided.

#8220gang #WaterSigbin #threatintel #cryptominer #IOC #CVE_2017_3506 #CVE_2023_21839

posts.content:
Trend Micro: Decoding Water Sigbin's Latest Obfuscation Tricks
Trend Micro writes about the 8220 gang, a Chinese financially motivated threat actor group known for deploying cryptominers in cloud-based environments and Linux servers. They write about the exploitation of Oracle WebLogic vulnerabilities CVE-2017-3506 (7.4 high) and CVE-2023-21839 (7.5 high) to deploy a cryptocurrency miner via a PowerShell script. They provide an analysis of the bat file. IOC and MITRE ATT&CK TTPs provided.

#8220gang #WaterSigbin #threatintel #cryptominer #IOC #CVE_2017_3506 #CVE_2023_21839

CVE-2017-3506.description: Vulnerability in the Oracle WebLogic Server component of Oracle Fusion Middleware (subcomponent: Web Services). Supported versions that are affected are 10.3.6.0, 12.1.3.0, 12.2.1.0, 12.2.1.1 and 12.2.1.2. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via HTTP to compromise Oracle WebLogic Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized creation, deletion or modification access to critical data or all Oracle WebLogic Server accessible data as well as unauthorized access to critical data or complete access to all Oracle WebLogic Server accessible data. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 7.4 (Confidentiality and Integrity impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:N).

posts.content:
JetBrains security advisory: TeamCity Major Bug-Fix Release for All Versions: Update Your Server Now
JetBrains, without revealing any details, discloses CVE-2024-36470. "We have since discovered that the security patch plugin doesn’t provide an optimal long-term way of protecting a TeamCity server from these vulnerabilities. In specific edge cases, it might still be possible to bypass the plugin."
EDIT: official NVD description for CVE-2024-36470 (CVSSv3: 8.1 high) was made available:

In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases

TeamCity 2024.03.2 Release Notes states that "8 security issues were fixed."

#CVE #JetBrains #vulnerability #teamcity #CVE_2024_36470

posts.content:
HANG ONTO YOUR BUTTS! JetBrains has 18 vulnerabilities today. See parent toot for blog post:

  • CVE-2024-36470 (8.1 high) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases
  • CVE-2024-36378 (5.9 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 server was susceptible to DoS attacks with incorrect auth tokens
  • CVE-2024-36377 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 certain TeamCity API endpoints did not check user permissions
  • CVE-2024-36376 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 users could perform actions that should not be available to them based on their permissions
  • CVE-2024-36375 (5.3 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 technical information regarding TeamCity server could be exposed
  • CVE-2024-36374 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 stored XSS via build step settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36373 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 several stored XSS in untrusted builds settings were possible
  • CVE-2024-36372 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5 reflected XSS on the subscriptions page was possible
  • CVE-2024-36371 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS in Commit status publisher was possible
  • CVE-2024-36370 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via OAuth connection settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36369 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via issue tracker integration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36368 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 reflected XSS via OAuth provider configuration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36367 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via third-party reports was possible
  • CVE-2024-36366 (5.4 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 an XSS could be executed via certain report grouping and filtering operations
  • CVE-2024-36365 (6.8 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 a third-party agent could impersonate a cloud agent
  • CVE-2024-36364 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 improper access control in Pull Requests and Commit status publisher build features was possible
  • CVE-2024-36363 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 several Stored XSS in code inspection reports were possible
  • CVE-2024-36362 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 path traversal allowing to read files from server was possible

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE

posts.content:
Ivanti security advisory: CVE-2024-22058 Privilege Escalation for Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM)
CVE-2024-22058 (7.8 high) buffer overflow to arbitrary code execution with elevated permissions in Ivanti EPM 2021.1 SU5 and older. EPM 2022 and later are not impacted. The vulnerability affects legacy Remote Control, which is not included in EPM 2022 forward.

We are not aware of any customers being exploited by this vulnerability at the time of disclosure.

#CVE_2024_22058 #Ivanti #EPM #vulnerability #CVE

posts.content:
Zero Day Initiative (ZDI): CVE-2024-30043: Abusing Url Parsing Confusion To Exploit XXE On Sharepoint Server And Cloud
Piotr Bazydło covers CVE-2024-30043 (6.5 medium, disclosed 14 May 2024 by Microsoft) Microsoft SharePoint Server information disclosure vulnerability, referred to as an XML eXternal Entity (XXE) injection vulnerability. His motivation for writing it is the attractiveness (to an attacker) of a vulnerability affecting both on-prem and cloud SharePoint instances, and that "This is one of the craziest XXEs that I have ever seen (and found), both in terms of vulnerability discovery and the method of triggering." The impact of CVE-2024-30043 allows for file read with SharePoint Farm Service account permission, Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) attacks, NTLM relay attacks, and other XXE side effects.

This blog includes such gems like "Who cares anyway? YOLO and let’s move along with the exploitation." Piotr provides a detailed walkthrough leading to the exploitation, along with a Proof of Concept.

#CVE_2024_30043 #XXE #SharePoint #vulnerability #CVE #rootcauseanalysis #proofofconcept

posts.content:
Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

Other exploited vulnerablities:

  • CVE-2023-46805
  • CVE-2024-21887
  • CVE-2023-1389
  • CVE-2022-22954
  • CVE-2018-20062
  • CVE-2017-9841

#retail #cryptominer #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2024_3400 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #CVE_2023_1389 #CVE_2022_22954 #CVE_2018_20062 #CVE_2017_9841

Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

Other exploited vulnerablities:

  • CVE-2023-46805
  • CVE-2024-21887
  • CVE-2023-1389
  • CVE-2022-22954
  • CVE-2018-20062
  • CVE-2017-9841

posts.content:
Rapid7:CVE-2024-4978: Backdoored Justice AV Solutions Viewer Software Used in Apparent Supply Chain Attack
WAKE UP, NEW BACKDOOR! Rapid7 reports that an installation file of Justice AV Solutions (JAVS) has been backdoored, which delivers GateDoor/Rustdoor malware. JAVS Suite 8 is a portfolio of audio/video recording, viewing, and management software for government organizations and businesses. This is being tracked as CVE-2024-4978 (CVSSv4 8.7 high, CVSSv3 8.4, disclosed 22 May 2024 by CISA on behalf of Rapid7). They described observed attacker behavior, an exploitation timeline, and IOC.

fffmpeg.exe persistently communicates with a C2 server using Windows sockets and WinHTTP requests ... Malicious PowerShell scripts will attempt to bypass the Anti-Malware Scan Interface (AMSI) and disable Event Tracing for Windows (ETW).

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @todb @mttaggart

#CVE_2024_4978 #backdoor #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #trojan #gatedoor #rustdoor #vulnerability #JusticeAV #threatintel #IOC

Grimes, CPA, CISSP, CEH, MCSE, CISA, CISM, CNE, yada, yada, Data-Driven Defense Evangelist for KnowBe4, Inc., is the author of 14 books and over 1400 articles on computer security, specializing in host security and preventing hacker and malware attacks. Roger is a frequent speaker at national computer security conferences and was the weekly security columnist at InfoWorld and CSO magazines between 2005 - 2019. He has worked at some of the world’s largest computer security companies, including, Foundstone, McAfee, and Microsoft. Roger is frequently interviewed and quoted in the media including Newsweek, CNN, NPR, and WSJ. His presentations are fast-paced and filled with useful facts and recommendations.

posts.content:
Popular courtroom recording software was infected with a backdoor trojan malware program for months. Many courts and court cases likely impacted. I'm a little surprised this isn't getting more press.

https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/05/23/cve-2024-4978-backdoored-justice-av-solutions-viewer-software-used-in-apparent-supply-chain-attack

account.note: Adventurer. Takes a lot of photos, calls many places home. Vulnerability research director @ Rapid7. Opinions mine, etc. She/her.

fields.name: Website
fields.value: caitlincondon.com

posts.content:
In the course of investigating suspicious behavior in an MDR customer environment, Rapid7 discovered an apparent supply chain attack in the form of a backdoored installer being hosted on a legitimate vendor’s website. The vendor, Justice AV Solutions, makes AV software used in (among other things) courtrooms, prisons, and interrogations. Rapid7 MDR has observed C2 callbacks and other post-exploitation behavior related to the backdoored software in multiple customer environments.

Huge shout-out to all the MDR, IR, and vuln research folks who worked to validate and document findings, notify affected MDR customers, and investigate related activity. And an equally huge shout-out to @cisagov for their prompt assistance with disclosure.

The backdoored software was assigned CVE-2024-4978. Full write-up with attacker behavior observations, IOCs, guidance, and vendor statement here: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/05/23/cve-2024-4978-backdoored-justice-av-solutions-viewer-software-used-in-apparent-supply-chain-attack/

posts.content:
CISA confirms CVE-2024-1086 active attacks in the wild on Linux kernel versions 5.14-6.6.14 using netfilter vuln for privilege escalation. Major distros like Debian, Fedora, RHEL, Ubuntu affected. Check if you're patched with "uname -r".

Mitigation steps in article. Stay safe!

https://opensourcewatch.beehiiv.com/p/nasty-linux-bug-cve20241086-loose

@screaminggoat

#infosec #CISA #linuxsecurity #vulnerability #CVE_2024_1086

posts.content:
Currently top trending vulnerability on Twitter according to CVE Trends:
CVE-2024-1086 (7.8 high, disclosed 30 January 2024 by Google, Proof of Concept and vulnerability details available) Linux Kernel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability, working on most Linux kernels between v5.14 and v6.6, including Debian, Ubuntu, and KernelCTF.

Due to a use-after-free vulnerability in the netfilter: nf_tables component of the Linux kernel, the nft_verdict_init() function allows the use of positive values as a drop error in the hook verdict. When NF_DROP issues a drop error similar to NF_ACCEPT, the nf_hook_slow() function could lead to a double-free vulnerability. Local attackers could exploit this flaw to elevate privileges from a regular user to root.

There's an amusing shitpost "No way to prevent this" say users of only language where this regularly happens courtesy of @cadey

#CVE_2024_1086 #Linux #CVE #vulnerability

Tracked as CVE-2024-1086 and confirmed exploitation in the wild. Successful exploitation could allow an attacker local access to gain privilege escalation - which could in turn result in root-level access.

Originally disclosed in JAN 2024.

This has been fixed in multiple stable kernel versions.

posts.content:
🔥 Notselwyn's latest blog post is a must-read for anyone interested in Linux kernel exploitation! 🐧

In "Flipping Pages," they dive deep into CVE-2024-1086, a double-free vulnerability in nf_tables, and demonstrates how to craft a powerful Linux Privilege Escalation exploit. 🚨

Notselwyn walks us through his entire process, from finding the bug to developing novel techniques.

Key highlights:

🔸 mitigations like KASLR, KPTI, SMAP, and SMEP
🔸 arbitrary R/W primitives from userland
🔸 exploitation for maximum stealth

Perhaps most impressive is the exploit's broad compatibility (thanks to data-only techniques) and rock-solid stability (93-99% success rate!). 💪

Whether you're a beginner looking to learn or a seasoned researcher seeking inspiration, this blogpost has something for you. It's clear that Notselwyn put a ton of effort into making this both educational and practical.

At the time of writing, the stable branches linux-5.15.y, linux-6.1.y, and linux-6.6.y are affected by this exploit, and perhaps linux-6.7.1

https://pwning.tech/nftables/

#Infosec #LinuxKernel #Exploitation #VulnerabilityResearch

CVE-2024-1086.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's netfilter: nf_tables component can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation.

The nft_verdict_init() function allows positive values as drop error within the hook verdict, and hence the nf_hook_slow() function can cause a double free vulnerability when NF_DROP is issued with a drop error which resembles NF_ACCEPT.

We recommend upgrading past commit f342de4e2f33e0e39165d8639387aa6c19dff660.

posts.content:
Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

Other exploited vulnerablities:

  • CVE-2023-46805
  • CVE-2024-21887
  • CVE-2023-1389
  • CVE-2022-22954
  • CVE-2018-20062
  • CVE-2017-9841

#retail #cryptominer #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2024_3400 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #CVE_2023_1389 #CVE_2022_22954 #CVE_2018_20062 #CVE_2017_9841

CVE-2023-1389.description: TP-Link Archer AX21 (AX1800) firmware versions before 1.1.4 Build 20230219 contained a command injection vulnerability in the country form of the /cgi-bin/luci;stok=/locale endpoint on the web management interface. Specifically, the country parameter of the write operation was not sanitized before being used in a call to popen(), allowing an unauthenticated attacker to inject commands, which would be run as root, with a simple POST request.

The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

Other exploited vulnerablities:

  • CVE-2023-46805
  • CVE-2024-21887
  • CVE-2023-1389
  • CVE-2022-22954
  • CVE-2018-20062
  • CVE-2017-9841

#retail #cryptominer #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2024_3400 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #CVE_2023_1389 #CVE_2022_22954 #CVE_2018_20062 #CVE_2017_9841

CVE-2017-9841.description: Util/PHP/eval-stdin.php in PHPUnit starting with 4.8.19 and before 4.8.28, as well as 5.x before 5.6.3, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP code via HTTP POST data beginning with a `<?php ` substring, as demonstrated by an attack on a site with an exposed /vendor folder, i.e., external access to the /vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/Util/PHP/eval-stdin.php URI.

CVE-2024-3400.description:
A command injection vulnerability in the GlobalProtect feature of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software for specific PAN-OS versions and distinct feature configurations may enable an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the firewall.

Fixes for PAN-OS 10.2, PAN-OS 11.0, and PAN-OS 11.1 are in development and are expected to be released by April 14, 2024. Cloud NGFW, Panorama appliances, and Prisma Access are not impacted by this vulnerability. All other versions of PAN-OS are also not impacted.

Summoning Team: Molding Lies Into Reality || Exploiting CVE-2024-4358
SinSinology of Summoning Team provides an exploit chain for CVE-2024-4358 (9.8 critical disclosed 29 May 2024 by Progress) Progress Telerik Report Server authentication bypass and CVE-2024-1800 (9.9 critical, disclosed 20 March 2024 by Progress) deserialization of untrusted data. posts.content:
Cloudflare:Disrupting FlyingYeti's campaign targeting Ukraine
Cloudflare disrupted a phishing campaign by Russia-aligned threat actor (FlyingYeti aka UAC-0149) targeting Ukraine. FlyingYeti used debt-themed lures regarding the end of Ukraine's eviction and utility service termination moratorium in January 2024. The infection chain starts with malicious files leveraging CVE-2023-38831 (7.8 high, disclosed 23 August 2023 by Group-IB as an exploited zero-day: WinRAR Code Execution Vulnerability) eventually resulting in COOKBOX malware. The campaign was detected on 18 April 2024 with several weeks of reconnaissance/weaponization activity before being successfully disrupted. Cloudflare provides provide recommendations, detections (including PowerShell, Microsoft Sentinel, and Splunk scripts), and indicators of compromise. Extremely impressive write-up.

#threatintel #UAC0149 #FlyingYeti #IOC #cyberespionage #Ukraine #Russia #RussiaUkraineWar #CVE_2023_38831

Cloudflare:Disrupting FlyingYeti's campaign targeting Ukraine
Cloudflare disrupted a phishing campaign by Russia-aligned threat actor (FlyingYeti aka UAC-0149) targeting Ukraine. FlyingYeti used debt-themed lures regarding the end of Ukraine's eviction and utility service termination moratorium in January 2024. The infection chain starts with malicious files leveraging CVE-2023-38831 (7.8 high, disclosed 23 August 2023 by Group-IB as an exploited zero-day: WinRAR Code Execution Vulnerability) eventually resulting in COOKBOX malware. #threatintel #UAC0149 #FlyingYeti #IOC #cyberespionage #Ukraine #Russia #RussiaUkraineWar #CVE_2023_38831

CVE-2023-38831.description: RARLabs WinRAR before 6.23 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code when a user attempts to view a benign file within a ZIP archive. The issue occurs because a ZIP archive may include a benign file (such as an ordinary .JPG file) and also a folder that has the same name as the benign file, and the contents of the folder (which may include executable content) are processed during an attempt to access only the benign file. This was exploited in the wild in April through August 2023.

posts.content:
Horizon3: CVE-2023-48788: Revisiting Fortinet FortiClient EMS to Exploit 7.2.X
Horizon3 concluded that their exploit from the previous deep-dive on CVE-2023-48788 (9.8 critical, disclosed 22 February 2024 by Fortinet, with proof of concept by Horizon3) only affected FortiClient EMS 7.0.x versions. They discuss the differences in exploitation between FortiClient EMS's two mainline versions: 7.0.x and 7.2.x. Horizon3 also includes insights into the issues surrounding the exploit development for CVE-2023-48788 to determine success.

CVE-2024-21683 Atlassian Confluence RCE exploit is already out.
Credit goes to Huong Kieu
https://twitter.com/realalphaman_
and his writeup https://realalphaman.substack.com/p/quick-note-about-cve-2024-21683-authenticated

CVE-2024-21683.description:
This High severity RCE (Remote Code Execution) vulnerability was introduced in version 5.2 of Confluence Data Center and Server.

This RCE (Remote Code Execution) vulnerability, with a CVSS Score of 8.3, allows an authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code which has high impact to confidentiality, high impact to integrity, high impact to availability, and requires no user interaction. 

Atlassian recommends that Confluence Data Center and Server customers upgrade to latest version. If you are unable to do so, upgrade your instance to one of the specified supported fixed versions. See the release notes https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-release-notes-327.html

You can download the latest version of Confluence Data Center and Server from the download center https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives.

This vulnerability was found internally.

CVE-2024-2961.description: The iconv() function in the GNU C Library versions 2.39 and older may overflow the output buffer passed to it by up to 4 bytes when converting strings to the ISO-2022-CN-EXT character set, which may be used to crash an application or overwrite a neighbouring variable.

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-5493 (high) Chromium: CVE-2024-5493 Heap buffer overflow in WebRTC
  • CVE-2024-5494 (high) Chromium: CVE-2024-5494 Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-5495 (high) Chromium: CVE-2024-5495 Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-5496 (high) Chromium: CVE-2024-5496 Use after free in Media Session
  • CVE-2024-5497 (high) Chromium: CVE-2024-5497 Out of bounds memory access in Keyboard Inputs
  • CVE-2024-5498 (high) Chromium: CVE-2024-5498 Use after free in Presentation API
  • CVE-2024-5499 (high) Chromium: CVE-2024-5499 Out of bounds write in Streams API

These CVEs were assigned by Chrome. Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses these vulnerabilities. No mention of exploitation. These CVEs were disclosed Thursday 30 May 2024 by Google (see parent toot above). Today's updates were minimally documented in Release notes for Microsoft Edge Security Updates

fields.name: Blog
fields.value: https://infosec.press/screaminggoat/

posts.content:
@neustradamus For context, nginx is a popular open source web server (HTTP and reverse proxy server, mail proxy server, and generic TCP/UDP proxy server). Shodan search shows 34,582,612 worldwide, with the U.S. and China almost tied in the high 7 million each. The following vulnerabilities were fixed 29 May 2024:

  • CVE-2024-32760 (6.5 med) OOB write to DoS (or worse)
  • CVE-2024-31079 (4.8 med) stack buffer overflow to DoS
  • CVE-2024-35200 (5.3 med) Null pointer dereference to DoS
  • CVE-2024-34161 (5.3 med) UAF info disclosure

I think it's funny that F5 disclosed their own security advisories of these vulns as "final" because they don't affect any of their products.

account.note: This is not Simon. Opinions are made by a screaming goat and do not express the views or opinions of his goatherder. Timely and actionable goat information.

I think it's funny that F5 disclosed their own security advisories of these vulns as "final" because they don't affect any of their products.

posts.content:
One of the IP addresses in the IOC provided by Check Point (see parent toot above) 156.146.56.136 was previously reported by Volexity in Zero-Day Exploitation of Atlassian Confluence (02 June 2022). CVE-2022-26134 (9.8 critical, disclosed 02 June 2022 by Atlassian as an exploited zero-day) Confluence Data Center and Server RCE was exploited by likely Chinese actors:

Volexity has reason to believe this exploit is currently in use by multiple threat actors and that the likely country of origin of these attackers is China.

There is a very likely link to Chinese threat actors based on the zero-day exploitation of a VPN. Following Cisco's reporting of ArcaneDoor campaign by state-sponsored actors (likely China) on 24 April 2024. cc: @campuscodi @hrbrmstr @zeljkazorz

#CVE_2024_24919 #activeexploitation #eitw #CheckPoint #VPN #IOC #threatintel #China #cyberespionage

CVE-2022-26134.description: In affected versions of Confluence Server and Data Center, an OGNL injection vulnerability exists that would allow an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code on a Confluence Server or Data Center instance. The affected versions are from 1.3.0 before 7.4.17, from 7.13.0 before 7.13.7, from 7.14.0 before 7.14.3, from 7.15.0 before 7.15.2, from 7.16.0 before 7.16.4, from 7.17.0 before 7.17.4, and from 7.18.0 before 7.18.1.

posts.content:
Codean's Thomas Rinsma has published a write-up of a bug he found in Mozilla's PDF.js PDF file viewer.

The bug could have allowed threat actors to run malicious code inside apps where the PDF.js library was used and left misconfigured.

It's a pretty niche scenario, but 10/10 on the nasty scale.

posts.content:
🚨POC RELEASED🚨PoC for CVE-2024-4367 & CVE-2024-34342: Arbitrary JavaScript execution in PDF.js

#DarkWeb #Cybersecurity #Security #Cyberattack #Cybercrime #Privacy #Infosec #CVE20244367 #CVE202434342 #Vulnerability

https://x.com/DarkWebInformer/status/1793295146588459283

CVE-2024-4367.description:
### Impact
If pdf.js is used to load a malicious PDF, and PDF.js is configured with `isEvalSupported` set to `true` (which is the default value), unrestricted attacker-controlled JavaScript will be executed in the context of the hosting domain.

### Patches
The patch removes the use of `eval`:
https://github.com/mozilla/pdf.js/pull/18015

### Workarounds
Set the option `isEvalSupported` to `false`. 

### References
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1893645

posts.content:
Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) Chromium security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-5157 (high) Chromium: Use after free in Scheduling.
  • CVE-2024-5158 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-5159 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE.
  • CVE-2024-5160 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in Dawn.
  • CVE-2024-5274 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses these vulnerabilities. Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-5274 exists in the wild.

Note: These vulnerabilities were disclosed on Tuesday 21 May 2024 (see parent toot above) and the zero-day on Thursday 23 May 2024.

#CVE_2024_5157 #CVE_2024_5158 #CVE_2024_5159 #CVE_2024_5160 #CVE_2024_5274 #vulnerability #CVE #MSRC #Microsoft #Chrome

posts.content:
@browserversiontracker For reference: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-relnotes-security

Microsoft has a fix for CVE-2024-5274 to Microsoft Edge Stable Channel (Version 125.0.2535.67), which has been reported by the Chromium team as having an exploit in the wild. For more information, see the Security Update Guide

The issue is that Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) didn’t create (or make live) the CVE-2024-5274 page at the time of publishing this message on 24 May 2024. cc: @ruario

posts.content:
#Google fixes eighth actively exploited #Chrome zero-day this year

Another day, another 0 day in Chrome. It is another type confusion vulnerability in V8 (Chromium’s JavaScript engine). Evidence of active exploitation in the wild.

Tracked as CVE-2024-5274.

Affects #Chromium based web #browsers (not just Chrome), so maintained forks should be rolling updates ASAP.

#cve #cybersecurity #security #infosec

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/google-fixes-eighth-actively-exploited-chrome-zero-day-this-year/

posts.content:
Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) Chromium security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-5157 (high) Chromium: Use after free in Scheduling.
  • CVE-2024-5158 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-5159 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE.
  • CVE-2024-5160 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in Dawn.
  • CVE-2024-5274 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses these vulnerabilities. Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-5274 exists in the wild.

Note: These vulnerabilities were disclosed on Tuesday 21 May 2024 (see parent toot above) and the zero-day on Thursday 23 May 2024.

#CVE_2024_5157 #CVE_2024_5158 #CVE_2024_5159 #CVE_2024_5160 #CVE_2024_5274 #vulnerability #CVE #MSRC #Microsoft #Chrome

Microsoft has a fix for CVE-2024-5274 to Microsoft Edge Stable Channel (Version 125.0.2535.67), which has been reported by the Chromium team as having an exploit in the wild. For more information, see the Security Update Guide

The issue is that Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) didn’t create (or make live) the CVE-2024-5274 page at the time of publishing this message on 24 May 2024. cc: @ruario

posts.content:
Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

Other exploited vulnerablities:

  • CVE-2023-46805
  • CVE-2024-21887
  • CVE-2023-1389
  • CVE-2022-22954
  • CVE-2018-20062
  • CVE-2017-9841

#retail #cryptominer #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2024_3400 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #CVE_2023_1389 #CVE_2022_22954 #CVE_2018_20062 #CVE_2017_9841

posts.content:
//The #Pegasus sent an iMessage to its targets that contained what appeared to be GIF images, but which in fact contained a JBIG2 image. A vulnerability in the Xpdf implementation of JBIG2, re-used in Apple's iOS phone operating software, allowed Pegasus to construct an emulated computer architecture inside the JBIG2 stream which was then used to implement the zero-click attack. Apple fixed the vulnerability in iOS 14.8 in September 2021 as CVE-2021-30860 //
👻 😱 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pegasus_(spyware)

CVE-2021-30860.description: An integer overflow was addressed with improved input validation. This issue is fixed in Security Update 2021-005 Catalina, iOS 14.8 and iPadOS 14.8, macOS Big Sur 11.6, watchOS 7.6.2. Processing a maliciously crafted PDF may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited.

posts.content:
Trend Micro: Decoding Water Sigbin's Latest Obfuscation Tricks
Trend Micro writes about the 8220 gang, a Chinese financially motivated threat actor group known for deploying cryptominers in cloud-based environments and Linux servers. They write about the exploitation of Oracle WebLogic vulnerabilities CVE-2017-3506 (7.4 high) and CVE-2023-21839 (7.5 high) to deploy a cryptocurrency miner via a PowerShell script. They provide an analysis of the bat file. IOC and MITRE ATT&CK TTPs provided.

#8220gang #WaterSigbin #threatintel #cryptominer #IOC #CVE_2017_3506 #CVE_2023_21839

CVE-2023-21839.description: Vulnerability in the Oracle WebLogic Server product of Oracle Fusion Middleware (component: Core).  Supported versions that are affected are 12.2.1.3.0, 12.2.1.4.0 and  14.1.1.0.0. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via T3, IIOP to compromise Oracle WebLogic Server.  Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in  unauthorized access to critical data or complete access to all Oracle WebLogic Server accessible data. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 7.5 (Confidentiality impacts).  CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N).

Remote attackers who obtain this account can bypass IP access control restrictions and log in to the backend system without being recorded in the system logs.

CVE-2023-46218.description:
This flaw allows a malicious HTTP server to set "super cookies" in curl that
are then passed back to more origins than what is otherwise allowed or
possible. This allows a site to set cookies that then would get sent to
different and unrelated sites and domains.

It could do this by exploiting a mixed case flaw in curl's function that
verifies a given cookie domain against the Public Suffix List (PSL). For
example a cookie could be set with `domain=co.UK` when the URL used a lower
case hostname `curl.co.uk`, even though `co.uk` is listed as a PSL domain.

Incorrect group change behaviour (CVE-2019-15901)
https://github.com/slicer69/doas/pull/23

CVE-2019-15901.description: An issue was discovered in slicer69 doas before 6.2 on certain platforms other than OpenBSD. A setusercontext(3) call with flags to change the UID, primary GID, and secondary GIDs was replaced (on certain platforms: Linux and possibly NetBSD) with a single setuid(2) call. This resulted in neither changing the group id nor initializing secondary group ids.

https://github.com/slicer69/doas/pull/23

CVE-2019-15900.description: An issue was discovered in slicer69 doas before 6.2 on certain platforms other than OpenBSD. On platforms without strtonum(3), sscanf was used without checking for error cases. Instead, the uninitialized variable errstr was checked and in some cases returned success even if sscanf failed. The result was that, instead of reporting that the supplied username or group name did not exist, it would execute the command as root.

posts.content:
HANG ONTO YOUR BUTTS! JetBrains has 18 vulnerabilities today. See parent toot for blog post:

  • CVE-2024-36470 (8.1 high) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases
  • CVE-2024-36378 (5.9 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 server was susceptible to DoS attacks with incorrect auth tokens
  • CVE-2024-36377 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 certain TeamCity API endpoints did not check user permissions
  • CVE-2024-36376 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 users could perform actions that should not be available to them based on their permissions
  • CVE-2024-36375 (5.3 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 technical information regarding TeamCity server could be exposed
  • CVE-2024-36374 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 stored XSS via build step settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36373 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 several stored XSS in untrusted builds settings were possible
  • CVE-2024-36372 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5 reflected XSS on the subscriptions page was possible
  • CVE-2024-36371 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS in Commit status publisher was possible
  • CVE-2024-36370 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via OAuth connection settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36369 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via issue tracker integration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36368 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 reflected XSS via OAuth provider configuration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36367 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via third-party reports was possible
  • CVE-2024-36366 (5.4 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 an XSS could be executed via certain report grouping and filtering operations
  • CVE-2024-36365 (6.8 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 a third-party agent could impersonate a cloud agent
  • CVE-2024-36364 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 improper access control in Pull Requests and Commit status publisher build features was possible
  • CVE-2024-36363 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 several Stored XSS in code inspection reports were possible
  • CVE-2024-36362 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 path traversal allowing to read files from server was possible

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE

posts.content:
Horizon3: CVE-2024-23108: Fortinet FortiSIEM 2nd Order Command Injection Deep-Dive
Fortinet back at it again with another deep dive of Fortinet FortiSIEM. After providing the vulnerability analysis for CVE-2023-34992 (see parent toot above), he briefly explains how CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 are patch bypasses. As @wdormann points out, "The injection-causing semicolon is moved from one argument to another. 🤦‍♂️" Proof of concept is provided.

You've read about it in Bleeping Computer's news article. Check out the vulnerability disclosure timeline here to see Zach Hanley's side of the story about Fortinet's botched disclosure.

#CVE_2024_23108 #proofofconcept #vulnerability #Horizon3 #Fortinet

account.note: This is not Simon. Opinions are made by a screaming goat and do not express the views or opinions of his goatherder. Timely and actionable goat information.

fields.name: Blog
fields.value: https://infosec.press/screaminggoat/

posts.content:
@wdormann I was there for this! someone noticed some perfect 10.0 CVSSv3 scoring vulnerabilities buried in a 4 month old security advisory without any changelog.

@serghei asked Fortinet PSIRT about them and they straight up lied about it: https://mastodon.social/@serghei/111889892600716875

Zach Hanley's response: https://twitter.com/hacks_zach/status/1755309941982646695

Lol not sure whats going on over there, but they're real were a bypass of the 2023 CVE it got added to

@BleepingComputer posted a subsequent update with the following statement: "After contacting Fortinet once again, we were told their previous statement was “misstated” and that the two new CVEs are variants of the original flaw."

"The PSIRT team followed its process to add two similar variants of the previous CVE (CVE-2023-34992), tracked as CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 to our public advisory FG-IR-23-130, which was published in October 2023. The two new CVEs share the exact same description and score as the initial one; in parallel we updated MITRE. A reminder pointing to the updated Advisory will be included for our customers on Tuesday when Fortinet publishes its monthly advisory." – Fortinet.”

posts.content:
Veeam has issued an “enhanced update” to address CVE-2024-29212, an RCE flaw in its Service Provider Console (VSPC).

“Although our initial patch, issued on May 7th, effectively addressed the primary concern, a subsequent review identified an area for further improvement. To ensure comprehensive protection, we swiftly developed and released a refined patch that fully mitigates the issue.”

https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/05/08/cve-2024-29212/

CVE-2022-32504.description: An issue was discovered on certain Nuki Home Solutions devices. The code used to parse the JSON objects received from the WebSocket service provided by the device leads to a stack buffer overflow. An attacker would be able to exploit this to gain arbitrary code execution on a KeyTurner device. This affects Nuki Smart Lock 3.0 before 3.3.5 and 2.0 before 2.12.4, as well as Nuki Bridge v1 before 1.22.0 and v2 before 2.13.2.

posts.content:
Sysdig: DDoS-as-a-Service: The Rebirth Botnet
Sysdig reports a DDoS-as-a-Service Mirai-based botnet using the domain rebirthltd[.]com to launch attacks. One of the vulnerabilities targeted is a Ruckus AP remote code execution/cross-site request forgery vulnerability CVE-2023-25717 (9.8 critical, disclosed 08 February 2023 by Ruckus, has proof of concept, added to CISA KEV Catalog on 12 May 2023).Sysdig describes motivations, attribution, campaigns, infection methods, and detection methods. IOC not really included.

#threatintel #ddos #botnet #CVE_2023_25717 #ruckus #mirai #rebirth #vulcan

posts.content:
Horizon3: CVE-2024-23108: Fortinet FortiSIEM 2nd Order Command Injection Deep-Dive
Fortinet back at it again with another deep dive of Fortinet FortiSIEM. After providing the vulnerability analysis for CVE-2023-34992 (see parent toot above), he briefly explains how CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 are patch bypasses. As @wdormann points out, "The injection-causing semicolon is moved from one argument to another. 🤦‍♂️" Proof of concept is provided.

You've read about it in Bleeping Computer's news article. Check out the vulnerability disclosure timeline here to see Zach Hanley's side of the story about Fortinet's botched disclosure.

#CVE_2024_23108 #proofofconcept #vulnerability #Horizon3 #Fortinet

account.note: This is not Simon. Opinions are made by a screaming goat and do not express the views or opinions of his goatherder. Timely and actionable goat information.

fields.name: Blog
fields.value: https://infosec.press/screaminggoat/

posts.content:
@wdormann I was there for this! someone noticed some perfect 10.0 CVSSv3 scoring vulnerabilities buried in a 4 month old security advisory without any changelog.

@serghei asked Fortinet PSIRT about them and they straight up lied about it: https://mastodon.social/@serghei/111889892600716875

Zach Hanley's response: https://twitter.com/hacks_zach/status/1755309941982646695

Lol not sure whats going on over there, but they're real were a bypass of the 2023 CVE it got added to

@BleepingComputer posted a subsequent update with the following statement: "After contacting Fortinet once again, we were told their previous statement was “misstated” and that the two new CVEs are variants of the original flaw."

"The PSIRT team followed its process to add two similar variants of the previous CVE (CVE-2023-34992), tracked as CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 to our public advisory FG-IR-23-130, which was published in October 2023. The two new CVEs share the exact same description and score as the initial one; in parallel we updated MITRE. A reminder pointing to the updated Advisory will be included for our customers on Tuesday when Fortinet publishes its monthly advisory." – Fortinet.”

posts.content:
DNSBomb has a website!: https://dnsbomb.net/ h/t: @shellsharks Assigned vulnerabilities associated with it:

  • Industry-wide: CVE-2024-33655
  • Knot: CVE-2023-49206
  • Simple DNS Plus: CVE-2023-49205
  • Technitium:
    • CVE-2023-28456
    • CVE-2023-49203
  • MaraDNS: CVE-2023-49204
  • Dnsmasq:
    • CVE-2023-28450 (7.5 high) An issue was discovered in Dnsmasq before 2.90. The default maximum EDNS.0 UDP packet size was set to 4096 but should be 1232 because of DNS Flag Day 2020.
    • CVE-2023-49207
  • CoreDNS:
    • CVE-2023-28454
    • CVE-2023-49202
  • SDNS: CVE-2023-49201

#DoS #DNSBomb

posts.content:

https://amalmurali.me/posts/git-rce/

https://github.blog/2024-05-14-securing-git-addressing-5-new-vulnerabilities/?ref=news.risky.biz

posts.content:
@alexandreborges CVE-2024-23897 was disclosed 24 January 2024.

Jenkins actually came out with a security advisory yesterday 24 May 2024: https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2024-05-24/

Here's a compact list of all of the recent Jenkins vulnerabilities: https://infosec.exchange/@screaminggoat/112496708575217983

CVE-2024-23897.description:
Jenkins has a built-in command line interface (CLI) to access Jenkins from a script or shell environment.

Jenkins uses the args4j library to parse command arguments and options on the Jenkins controller when processing CLI commands. This command parser has a feature that replaces an @ character followed by a file path in an argument with the file’s contents (expandAtFiles). This feature is enabled by default and Jenkins 2.441 and earlier, LTS 2.426.2 and earlier does not disable it.

This allows attackers to read arbitrary files on the Jenkins controller file system using the default character encoding of the Jenkins controller process.

* Attackers with Overall/Read permission can read entire files.

* Attackers without Overall/Read permission can read the first few lines of files. The number of lines that can be read depends on available CLI commands. As of publication of this advisory, the Jenkins security team has found ways to read the first three lines of files in recent releases of Jenkins without having any plugins installed, and has not identified any plugins that would increase this line count.

Binary files containing cryptographic keys used for various Jenkins features can also be read, with some limitations (see note on binary files below). As of publication, the Jenkins security team has confirmed the following possible attacks in addition to reading contents of all files with a known file path. All of them leverage attackers' ability to obtain cryptographic keys from binary files, and are therefore only applicable to instances where that is feasible.

posts.content:
Aqua Security: Linguistic Lumberjack: Understanding CVE-2024-4323 in Fluent Bit
Aqua provides an overview of the Linguistic Lumberjack vulnerability CVE-2024-4323 (see parent toot above for security advisory and CVE details). Fluent Bit is a highly popular open-source data collector and processor designed for handling large volumes of log data from various sources, and is supposedly used by all major cloud providers.
The flaw is due to improper validation of input names in requests, which can be exploited to cause memory corruption. This can result in denial-of-service attacks or information exposure, with remote code execution being possible under certain conditions.
Aqua's investigation reports that the built-in http server needs to be exposed to the internet in order for Fluent Bit to be vulnerable, and that 20 versions from various popular open source tools on Docker Hub had http turned off by default.
Aqua recommends upgrading Fluent Bit to the fixed version 3.0.4.

#LinguisticLumberjack #CVE_2024_4324 #CVE #vulnerability #FluentBit

posts.content:
well, i see fluent-bit folks are adding defensive programming stuff to "fix" CVE-2024-4323, sigh

the correct fix for that CVE is to adjust flb_sds_create_len() and related functions to take size_t for object sizes

CVE-2024-4323.description: A memory corruption vulnerability in Fluent Bit versions 2.0.7 thru 3.0.3. This issue lies in the embedded http server’s parsing of trace requests and may result in denial of service conditions, information disclosure, or remote code execution.

#Jenkins #PatchTuesday #CVE #vulnerability

CVE-2024-5273.description:
Jenkins Report Info Plugin 1.2 and earlier does not perform path validation of the workspace directory while serving report files.

Additionally, Report Info Plugin does not support distributed builds.

This results in a path traversal vulnerability, allowing attackers with Item/Configure permission to retrieve Surefire failures, PMD violations, Findbugs bugs, and Checkstyle errors on the controller file system by editing the workspace path.

As of publication of this advisory, there is no fix.

posts.content:
@reverseics It looks like the root cause of CVE-2020-17159 is your favorite Common Weakness Enumeration: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal') ../../../../etc/passwd
Here is the reporter's vulnerability analysis: https://www.vicarius.io/vsociety/posts/cve-2020-17519-apache-flink-directory-traversal-vulnerability

Unit 42 observed the CVE-2020-17159 exploit in the wild around 21 April 2021: https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/network-attack-trends-winter-2020/

CVE-2020-17519.description: A change introduced in Apache Flink 1.11.0 (and released in 1.11.1 and 1.11.2 as well) allows attackers to read any file on the local filesystem of the JobManager through the REST interface of the JobManager process. Access is restricted to files accessible by the JobManager process. All users should upgrade to Flink 1.11.3 or 1.12.0 if their Flink instance(s) are exposed. The issue was fixed in commit b561010b0ee741543c3953306037f00d7a9f0801 from apache/flink:master.

CVE-2024-22267.description: VMware Workstation and Fusion contain a use-after-free vulnerability in the vbluetooth device. A malicious actor with local administrative privileges on a virtual machine may exploit this issue to execute code as the virtual machine's VMX process running on the host.

KB Security Advisory Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM) May 2024

An unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability in Core server of Ivanti EPM 2022 SU5 and prior allows an unauthenticated attacker within the same network to execute arbitrary code.

It's actually 10 SQL Injections....

An unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability in Core server of Ivanti EPM 2022 SU5 and prior allows an unauthenticated attacker within the same network to execute arbitrary code.

It's actually 10 SQL Injections....

CVE-2024-29822
CVE-2024-29823
CVE-2024-29824
CVE-2024-29825
CVE-2024-29826
CVE-2024-29827

CVE-2024-29828

CVE-2024-29829

CVE-2024-29830

CVE-2024-29846

The good news, it's documented.

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-Security-Advisory-EPM-May-2024?language=en_US

#ivanti #vulnerability #vulnerabilities #infosec

posts.content:
Ivanti security advisory: Security Advisory May 2024
16 vulnerabilities across 5 Ivanti products. No exploitation but EVERYTHING is critical and high severity. See related blog post: May Security Update

  • Ivanti Avalanche:
    • CVE-2024-29848 (7.2 high) unrestricted file upload vulnerability
  • Ivanti Neurons for ITSM:
    • CVE-2024-22059 (8.8 high) SQL injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-22060 (8.7 high) unrestricted file upload vulnerability
  • Ivanti Connect Secure
    • CVE-2023-38551 (8.2 high) CRLF Injection vulnerability
  • Ivanti Secure Access
    • CVE-2023-38042 (7.8 high) local privilege escalation vulnerability
    • CVE-2023-46810 (7.3 high) local privilege escalation vulnerability
  • Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM)
    • CVE-2024-29822 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29823 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29824 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29825 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29826 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29827 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29828 (8.4 high) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29829 (8.4 high) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29830 (8.4 high) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29846 (8.4 high) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability

cc: @campuscodi

#Ivanti #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE #ConnectSecure #EPM #Avalanche

CVE-2024-29822.description: An unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability in Core server of Ivanti EPM 2022 SU5 and prior allows an unauthenticated attacker within the same network to execute arbitrary code.

posts.content: #GitHub Enterprise Server patches 10-outta-10 critical hole - CVE-2024-4985 #cybersecurity #infosec https://www.theregister.com/2024/05/22/github_enterprise_server_patch/?td=rt-3a @theregister

CVE-2024-4985.description: An authentication bypass vulnerability was present in the GitHub Enterprise Server (GHES) when utilizing SAML single sign-on authentication with the optional encrypted assertions feature. This vulnerability allowed an attacker to forge a SAML response to provision and/or gain access to a user with site administrator privileges. Exploitation of this vulnerability would allow unauthorized access to the instance without requiring prior authentication. This vulnerability affected all versions of GitHub Enterprise Server prior to 3.13.0 and was fixed in versions 3.9.15, 3.10.12, 3.11.10 and 3.12.4. This vulnerability was reported via the GitHub Bug Bounty program.

CVE-2024-36077 (8.8 High, disclosed 20 May 2024 by Qlik) Due to improper input validation, a remote attacker with existing privileges is able to elevate them to the internal system role, which in turns allows them to execute commands on the server.

no reports of it being maliciously exploited have been received.

Qlik security advisory: High Severity Security fixes for Qlik Sense Enterprise for Windows (CVE-2024-36077)
CVE-2024-36077 (8.8 High, disclosed 20 May 2024 by Qlik) Due to improper input validation, a remote attacker with existing privileges is able to elevate them to the internal system role, which in turns allows them to execute commands on the server.

no reports of it being maliciously exploited have been received.

CVE-2024-36077.description: Qlik Sense Enterprise for Windows before 14.187.4 allows a remote attacker to elevate their privilege due to improper validation. The attacker can elevate their privilege to the internal system role, which allows them to execute commands on the server. This affects February 2024 Patch 3 (14.173.3 through 14.173.7), November 2023 Patch 8 (14.159.4 through 14.159.13), August 2023 Patch 13 (14.139.3 through 14.139.20), May 2023 Patch 15 (14.129.3 through 14.129.22), February 2023 Patch 13 (14.113.1 through 14.113.18), November 2022 Patch 13 (14.97.2 through 14.97.18), August 2022 Patch 16 (14.78.3 through 14.78.23), and May 2022 Patch 17 (14.67.7 through 14.67.31). This has been fixed in May 2024 (14.187.4), February 2024 Patch 4 (14.173.8), November 2023 Patch 9 (14.159.14), August 2023 Patch 14 (14.139.21), May 2023 Patch 16 (14.129.23), February 2023 Patch 14 (14.113.19), November 2022 Patch 14 (14.97.19), August 2022 Patch 17 (14.78.25), and May 2022 Patch 18 (14.67.34).

elpe_pinillo: HEAP HEAP HOORAY — Unveiling GLIBC heap overflow vulnerability (CVE-2023–6246)
elpe_pinillo provides a vulnerability analysis of CVE-2023–6246 (CNA 8.4 high, NVD 7.8, disclosed 29 January 2024 by Red Hat) heap-based buffer overflow in the glibc library. They describe heap overflows, "Heap Feng Shui" (a real memory exploitation technique), and arriving at an exploit for CVE-2023_6246. h/t: @0xor0ne

#CVE_2023_6246 #glibc #vulnerability #CVE

elpe_pinillo: HEAP HEAP HOORAY — Unveiling GLIBC heap overflow vulnerability (CVE-2023–6246)
elpe_pinillo provides a vulnerability analysis of CVE-2023–6246 (CNA 8.4 high, NVD 7.8, disclosed 29 January 2024 by Red Hat) heap-based buffer overflow in the glibc library. They describe heap overflows, "Heap Feng Shui" (a real memory exploitation technique), and arriving at an exploit for CVE-2023_6246. h/t: @0xor0ne

#CVE_2023_6246 #glibc #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2023-6246.description: A heap-based buffer overflow was found in the __vsyslog_internal function of the glibc library. This function is called by the syslog and vsyslog functions. This issue occurs when the openlog function was not called, or called with the ident argument set to NULL, and the program name (the basename of argv[0]) is bigger than 1024 bytes, resulting in an application crash or local privilege escalation. This issue affects glibc 2.36 and newer.

posts.content:
Unit 42: Operation Diplomatic Specter: An Active Chinese Cyberespionage Campaign Leverages Rare Tool Set to Target Governmental Entities in the Middle East, Africa and Asia
Unit 42 reports on a Chinese APT (TGR-STA-0043) conducting an ongoing campaign (called Operation Diplomatic Specter) targeting political entities in the Middle East, Africa and Asia since at least late 2022. An analysis of this threat actor’s activity reveals long-term espionage operations against at least seven governmental entities. The threat actor performed intelligence collection efforts at a large scale, leveraging rare email exfiltration techniques against compromised servers. Their collection efforts are on geopolitical affairs: diplomatic/economic missions, embassies, military operations, political meetings, ministries, and high ranking officials. This includes two new backdoors, called TunnelSpecter and SweetSpecter. Microsoft Exchange vulnerabilities CVE-2021-26855 (ProxyLogon) and CVE-2021-34473 (ProxyShell) are used for initial access. There’s a lot of information about motivation, victimology, malware analyses, attribution, overlaps with other Chinese threat actors, etc. IOC provided.

#threatintel #cyberespionage #TGRSTA0043 #China #IOC #OperationDiplomaticSpecter #CVE_2021_26855 #CVE_2021_34473 #ProxyLogon #ProxyShell

CVE-2018-11776.description: Apache Struts contains a Remote Code Execution when using results with no namespace and it's upper actions have no or wildcard namespace. The same flaw exists when using a url tag with no value, action set,  and it's upper actions have no or wildcard namespace.

posts.content:
Reporting issues in Windows. 🤡

* August, 25, 2023: Issue reported to MSRC.
…
* April 9, 2024: Fix released as CVE-2024-20693.
* April 25, 2024: MSRC asks Microsoft Bounty Team for an update, CCing us.
* April 26, 2024: Microsoft Bounty Team sends back a boilerplate reply that the case is under review.
* May 17, 2024: MSRC asks Microsoft Bounty Team for an update, CCing us again.
* May 22, 2024: Microsoft Bounty Team replies that the vulnerability is out of scope for a bounty, claiming it wasn’t reproduced on the right WIP build.

#Microsoft #MSRC

#Cisco #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_20293 #CVE #CVE_2024_20363 #CVE #CVE_2024_20261 #CVE #CVE_2024_20239 #CVE #CVE_2024_20361 #CVE #CVE_2024_20355

CVE-2024-20293.description: A vulnerability in the activation of an access control list (ACL) on Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software and Cisco Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to bypass the protection that is offered by a configured ACL on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to a logic error that occurs when an ACL changes from inactive to active in the running configuration of an affected device. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending traffic through the affected device that should be denied by the configured ACL. The reverse condition is also true—traffic that should be permitted could be denied by the configured ACL. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to bypass configured ACL protections on the affected device, allowing the attacker to access trusted networks that the device might be protecting. Note: This vulnerability applies to both IPv4 and IPv6 traffic as well as dual-stack ACL configurations in which both IPv4 and IPv6 ACLs are configured on an interface.
